perturbation.original_text: This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement. This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies.
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment shall apply to said PCQ and ABW and all of their subsidiaries and related companies. This amendment to Section 2 (titled "Term"), Part B of the Co-Branding Agreement is made effective December 9, 1996 by and between PC Quote, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "PCQ") and A.B. Watley, Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "ABW"), who are also the parties contracted in the aforementioned Co-Branding Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Reversing the order of the two sentences creates confusion regarding the scope and applicability of the amendment. The initial clear statement of applicability is buried later on, creating confusion if the amendment is applied to all subsidiaries or just to PCQ and ABW.

perturbation.changed_text: /s/ Steven Malin /s/ Howard Meltzer - -------------------------- --------------------------------- A.B. Watley, Inc. PC Quote, Inc. Mr. Steven Malin Mr. Howard Meltzer Director President Date:  12/5/96 Date:    Invalid Date
perturbation.explanation: Changing the date for PC Quote, Inc. signature to Invalid Date creates uncertainty regarding the valid execution of the contract. This raises doubts whether the contract was ever legally binding to PC Quote, Inc, as a valid date of acceptance is key for establishing a contract.
